contentrichtext.text: {{Other people|David Rose}} '''David Stuart Rose''' (June 30, 1856 – August 8, 1932)<ref>'Memorial at Rose's Grave is Dedicated-Milwaukeeans Honor Former Mayor at Darlington, '''Milwaukee Sentinel,''' May 26, 1935</ref> was an [[United States|American]] [[politician]] and was twice elected [[List of mayors of Milwaukee|mayor of the city of Milwaukee, Wisconsin]] serving from 1898 to 1906 and from 1908 to 1910.<ref>[http://politicalgraveyard.com/bio/rose.html Database]</ref> Born in [[Darlington, Wisconsin]], he joined his father's law firm in Darlington. He served as mayor of Darlington in 1883 and 1884 and was county judge of [[Lafayette County, Wisconsin]]. In 1886, he moved to Milwaukee where he practiced law.<ref>[http://www.wisconsinhistory.org/dictionary/index.asp?action=view&term_id=1717&keyword=rose Wisconsin Historical Society-David Stuart Rose]</ref> He died in Milwaukee. ==Notes== {{reflist}} {{S-start}} {{Succession box|title=[[List of mayors of Milwaukee|Mayor of Milwaukee]]|before=[[William C. Rauschenberger]]|after=[[Sherburn M. Becker]]|years=1898–1906}} {{Succession box|title=[[List of mayors of Milwaukee|Mayor of Milwaukee]]|before=[[Sherburn M. Becker]]|after=[[Emil Seidel]]|years=1908–1910}} {{S-end}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Rose, David S. | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American mayor | DATE OF BIRTH = June 30, 1856 | PLACE OF BIRTH = Darlington, Wisconsin | DATE OF DEATH = August 8, 1932 | PLACE OF DEATH = Milwaukee, Wisconsin }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Rose, David S.}} [[Category:1856 births]] [[Category:1932 deaths]] [[Category:People from Lafayette County, Wisconsin]] [[Category:Mayors of Milwaukee, Wisconsin]] [[Category:Mayors of places in Wisconsin]] [[Category:Wisconsin lawyers]] [[Category:Wisconsin state court judges]]
